subject: Home & DIY
title: Why Basements Flood
description: Learn Why Basements Flood in one minute.

hook.text: Sixty percent of US basements get wet. The cause is almost never plumbingâ€”it's the ground itself pushing water in.

buildup.text: Soil around foundations absorbs rain like a sponge. As hydrostatic pressure builds, water pushes through any crack.

discovery.text: Solid concrete is slightly porous. Water vapor migrates through basement walls nonstop, especially in wet seasons.

twist.text: Most basement flooding is fixed outside: grade soil away from the foundation and extend downspouts. That solves 90%.

climax.text: Sump pumps handle the remaining 10%. A battery backup is essentialâ€”power outages and heavy storms happen simultaneously.

punchline.text: Water comes from outside. Fix the outside first.

quiz.question: What causes most basement flooding?
options: Hydrostatic pressure from groundwater pushing through foundation cracks
Failed plumbing connections below the floor
Rising water tables from climate change
